definition: to be content with what one is

sentences.english: Buying Times will help Lotte increase scale in China, which is critical in such a competitive market.
sentences.chinese: 購買時代零售將有助於樂天百貨擴大在華業務規模。

sentences.english: The twin sisters have a happy disposition.
sentences.chinese: 這一對孿生姐妹有一種樂天的性格。

sentences.english: That was part of the secret of the gay genius.
sentences.chinese: 這就是這位曠古奇才樂天派的奧祕的一面。

sentences.english: A convivial individual, he / she enjoys being with their friends, and likes a laugh.
sentences.chinese: 這種人是樂天派，喜歡跟朋友在一起，愛笑。

sentences.english: Opti the Mystic had been born in that bomber's wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 於是，在轟炸機的殘骸裏，一個老樂天誕生了。

sentences.english: He's good-time Charlie, who won't feel quit disappointed at this.
sentences.chinese: 他是個樂天派，對此事不會感到十分失望。

sentences.english: Shen Ming when son, surnamed white Lotte.
sentences.chinese: 時有沉冥子，姓白字樂天。

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成爲一位發明家或企業家，你必須得是個樂天派。

sentences.english: He’s an optimist about U.S.-China relations in general.
sentences.chinese: 他對於中美關係總體上是一個樂天派。

sentences.english: First optimistic attitude to life, contentment.
sentences.chinese: 首先要樂天知命，知足常樂。

sentences.english: I enjoy talking with those good-time Charlie.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡和那些樂天派們在一起聊天。

sentences.english: Being a Good-time Charlie, you feel content and pleasant, even when you are suffering terrible things.
sentences.chinese: 做一個樂天派，你會感到一種由衷的快樂。

sentences.english: Rakuten’s revenue comes from the fees it charges to its vendors.
sentences.chinese: 樂天的收入來源是向賣家收取的費用。

sentences.english: Life is full of compromises, so it's crucial to be optimistic.
sentences.chinese: 人生充滿了無奈，所以樂天知命是很重要的。

sentences.english: Perhaps you are a little bit more optimistic, a little bit more utopian-- human nature can be improved.
sentences.chinese: 也許你更樂觀，更加樂天，人性可以改善。

sentences.english: Kind of an optimistic, I suppose?

definition: South Korea (Republic of Korea)/Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄[zhan4 guo2 qi1 xiong2]/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897/Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国/surname Han
Seoul, capital of South Korea (Chinese name adopted in 2005 to replace 漢城|汉城[Han4 cheng2])
North Korea/Korea as geographic term/Taiwan pr. [Chao2 xian1]
entity/substance/thing that has a material existence (as opposed to a conceptual, virtual or online existence)/the real thing (as opposed to an image or model of it)

abbr. for 國民大會|国民大会, National Assembly of the Republic of China (extant during various periods between 1913 and 2005)/abbr. for 新加坡國立大學|新加坡国立大学, National University of Singapore (NUS)/abbr. for 印度國民大會黨|印度国民大会党, Indian National Congress (INC)/abbr. for 馬來西亞印度國民大會黨|马来西亚印度国民大会党, Malaysian Indian Congress (MIC)
